name: Accordion
description: An accordion is a vertical stack of interactive headings used to toggle the display of further information; each item can be 'collapsed' with just a short label visible or 'expanded' to show the full content.

name: Alert
description: A way of informing the user of important changes in a prominent way.

name: Avatar
description: A graphical representation of a user: usually a photo, illustration, or initial.

name: Badge
description: A small label, generally appearing inside or in close proximity to another larger interface component, representing a status, property, or some other metadata.

name: Breadcrumbs
description: A list of links showing the location of the current page in the navigational hierarchy.

name: Button
description: Buttons trigger an action such as submitting a form or showing/hiding an interface component.

name: Button group
description: A wrapper for multiple, related buttons.

name: Card
description: A container for content representing a single entity. e.g. a contact, article, or task.

name: Checkbox
Color picker
description: An input for choosing a color.

name: Combobox
description: An input that behaves similarly to a select, with the addition of a free text input to filter options.

name: Date input
description: A means of inputting a date – often separated into multiple individual fields for day/month/year.

name: Datepicker
description: A visual way to choose a date using a calendar view.

name: Drawer
description: A panel which slides out from the edge of the screen.

name: Dropdown menu
description: A menu in which options are hidden by default but can be shown by interacting with a button; it differs from a select in that it shows actions or navigation options and is not a form input.

name: Empty state
description: An indication to the user that there is no data to display in the current view; it often includes an alternative action (e.g. try a different search term).

name: Fieldset
description: A wrapper for related form fields.

name: File
description: A representation of a file such as an uploaded attachment or a downloadable PDF.

name: File upload
description: An input which allows users to upload a file from their device.

name: Footer
description: Commonly appearing at the bottom of a page or section, a footer is used to display copyright and legal information or links to related content.

name: Form
description: A grouping of input controls that allow a user to submit information to a server.

name: Header
description: An element that appears across the top of all pages on a website or application; it usually contains the site name and main navigation.

name: Heading
description: A title or caption used to introduce a new section.

name: Hero
description: A large banner, usually appearing as one of the first items on a page; it often contains a full-width image.

name: Horizontal rule
description: A separator between two elements, usually consisting of a horizontal line.

name: Icon
description: An icon is a graphic symbol designed to visually indicate the purpose of an interface element.

name: Image
description: An element for embedding images.

name: Label
description: A text label for form inputs.

name: Link
description: A link is a reference to a resource. This can be external (e.g. a different web page) or internal (e.g. a specific element in the current document).

name: List
description:
Lists are used for grouping a collection of related items. In HTML there are three types:

unordered list — for items in no particular order.
ordered list — for items in a specific order.
description list — for key-value pairs.

name: Modal
description: A modal is an interface element that appears over other content. It requires an interaction from the user before they can return to whatever is underneath.

name: Navigation
description: A container for navigation links; these can be to other pages (e.g. main site navigation) or to elements within the current page (e.g. a table of contents).

name: Pagination
description: Pagination is the process of splitting information over multiple pages instead of showing it all on a single page; also the name for the interface component used for navigating between these pages.

name: Progress bar
description: A horizontal bar indicating the current completion status of a long-running task, usually updated continuously as the task progresses, instead of in discrete steps.

name: Progress indicator
description: A representation of a user’s progress through a series of discrete steps.

name: Quote
description: Quotes are used to display a quotation: either from a person or another outside source or to highlight a passage of the current document (a pull quote).

name: Radio button
description: Radio buttons allow a user to select a single option from a list of predefined options.

name: Rating
description: Ratings let users see and/or set a star rating for a product or other item.

name: Rich text editor
description: An interface for editing “rich text” content (i.e. with formatting), usually through a WYSIWYG interface.

name: Search input
description: Search inputs allow users to find content by entering a search term.

name: Segmented control
description: A hybrid somewhere between a button group, radio buttons, and tabs; segmented controls are used to switch between different options or views.

name: Select
description: A form input used for selecting a value: when collapsed it shows the currently selected option and when expanded, it shows a scrollable list of predefined options for the user to choose from.

name: Skeleton
description: A placeholder layout for content which hasn't yet loaded, usually built up of grey boxes.

name: Skip link
description: Links within a page for skipping to another section, primarily for users who navigate using a keyboard.

name: Slider
description: A form control for choosing a value within a preset range of values.

name: Spinner
description: A visual indicator that a process is happening in the background but the interface is not yet ready for interaction.

name: Stack
description: A wrapper component for adding a consistent margin between components.

name: Stepper
description: A control for editing a numeric value with buttons for decrementing / incrementing.

name: Table
description: A component for displaying large amounts of data in rows and columns.

name: Tabs
description: Tabbed interfaces are a way of navigating between multiple panels, reducing clutter and fitting more into a smaller space.

name: Text input
description: A form control that accepts a single line of text.

name: Textarea
description: A form control for editing multi-line text.

name: Toast
description: A type of alert which appears in a layer above other content, visually similar to a mobile or desktop push notification.

name: Toggle
description: A control used to switch between two states: often on or off.

name: Tooltip
description: A means of displaying a description or extra information about an element, usually on hover, but can also be on click or tap.

name: Visually hidden
description: Invisible text used to provide extra context for users of assistive technology.
